abstract: Prosecutors in trial of James E Holmes enter into evidence notebook he mailed to his psychiatrist before shooting rampage at Aurora, Colo, movie theater, offering jurors window into Holmes's state of mind just before he killed 12 people and wounded 70 others in 2012; highlight sections concerned with killing people while Holmes's defense team point out passages that lend weight to their plea of not guilty by reason of insanity.
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors in the trial of James E. Holmes entered into evidence a notebook that he mailed to his psychiatrist shortly before he opened fire in a movie theater in Aurora, Colo., in 2012.

headline.main: Diary’s Pages May Help Jurors Decide if Colorado Gunman Was Methodical or Mad
headline.print_headline: Diary’s Pages May Help Jurors Decide if Theater Gunman Was Methodical or Mad

snippet: Prosecutors in the trial of James E. Holmes entered into evidence a notebook that he mailed to his psychiatrist shortly before he opened fire in a movie theater in Aurora, Colo., in 2012.
